title: Experiencing random freezing

embed.description: Watch Simple4Sample's League of Legends video: #nicepc - Plays.tv

body:
Specs:
Sapphire RX 480 8GB (reference card)
i5 6600
16 GB RAM

I'm experiencing random freezing that can last for up to two minutes. It happens completly randomly where it happens usually once every day. The freeze makes the whole PC freeze; the sound, cursor, game and every other program I have running. It began one month ago. I monitored this while it was happening with Open Hardware Monitor but I could not see any issues. Everything was running as normal. Any thought about this? {{summoner:3}} {{item:3151}}

replies.body: i think it's fair to say that it still exist ;) been happening for a long ass time... I hope next performance update fixes it.

Hmmmm this looks like it could possibly be a driver issue, or possibly some kind of hardware problem. Drivers are a lot quicker to check and easier to fix so let's start there. Check out this [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) and follow the other steps as well, and let me know if that helps at all!
Ok, after two weeks I can say that the issue is still not fixed. This is _not_ a FPS issue as this only happens for two minutes once a day. Any more suggestions?{{item:3151}}
It managed to fix itself somehow. I don't have any clue why it happened or why it stopped.{{summoner:1}}

ive had this issue too, although not nearly as bad as in the video, but it usually happens around the 4-5 minute mark, or first blood, whichever happens first but 'usually' only in the first game of the day
For me it happens in a random match at 15 min once a day
